detailedProjects.title: Open Care
detailedProjects.tagline: Comprehensive healthcare management platform for Bangladesh
detailedProjects.problem: Healthcare providers in Bangladesh lacked a unified digital platform to manage patient records, appointments, and medical services efficiently, leading to fragmented care delivery.
detailedProjects.context: Developed for a consortium of healthcare organizations serving 100,000+ patients across multiple facilities. Required HIPAA-compliant data handling and multi-tenant architecture.
contributions: Architected scalable microservices backend handling 50K+ daily transactions
Implemented secure patient data management with end-to-end encryption
Built RESTful APIs for appointment scheduling, medical records, and billing
Integrated third-party payment gateways and SMS notification services
Optimized database queries reducing average response time by 60%
detailedProjects.architecture: Microservices architecture with API Gateway, separate services for Patient Management, Appointments, Billing, and Analytics. Used event-driven communication via RabbitMQ for asynchronous operations.

challenges.challenge: Handling concurrent appointment bookings without conflicts across multiple facilities
challenges.solution: Implemented pessimistic locking with Redis-based distributed locks and real-time slot availability updates

challenges.challenge: Ensuring HIPAA compliance for sensitive patient data
challenges.solution: Applied AES-256 encryption at rest, TLS for data in transit, comprehensive audit logging, and role-based access control (RBAC)

challenges.challenge: System performance degradation during peak hours (9 AM - 12 PM)
challenges.solution: Introduced Redis caching for frequently accessed data, database query optimization, and horizontal scaling with load balancing

lessons: Importance of distributed locking in concurrent systems to prevent race conditions
Health data compliance requires security-first architecture from day one
Caching strategies significantly improve user experience during peak loads
Comprehensive monitoring and alerting are critical for healthcare applications

detailedProjects.title: National e-GP System
detailedProjects.tagline: Large-scale government procurement platform for transparent bidding
detailedProjects.problem: Bangladesh government procurement process was manual, opaque, and prone to inefficiencies and corruption, affecting billions of dollars in public spending.
detailedProjects.context: National-level e-governance initiative handling thousands of government tenders annually. Required highest levels of security, transparency, and audit trails.
contributions: Designed and implemented secure bidding workflow engine with multi-stage approvals
Built tamper-proof document management system with digital signatures
Created comprehensive audit logging system tracking all user actions
Developed advanced search and filtering for procurement opportunities
Implemented role-based access control for different stakeholder types
detailedProjects.architecture: Monolithic architecture with modular design. Separate modules for Tender Management, Bidding, Evaluation, Contract Management, and Audit. Used PostgreSQL with complex table partitioning for performance.

challenges.challenge: Ensuring absolute integrity of bid documents and preventing tampering
challenges.solution: Implemented PKI-based digital signatures, document hashing with SHA-256, and immutable audit trails stored in append-only logs

challenges.challenge: Managing complex multi-stage approval workflows with different authority levels
challenges.solution: Built flexible workflow engine using state machines, supporting parallel and sequential approvals with configurable routing rules

challenges.challenge: Handling large file uploads (100MB+) for technical documents
challenges.solution: Implemented chunked upload with resume capability, virus scanning integration, and S3-compatible object storage

lessons: Government systems require extensive audit trails and compliance features
Security and integrity are paramount when handling sensitive procurement data
Complex workflows need flexible, configurable engines to adapt to policy changes
Performance optimization is crucial when dealing with large document volumes

detailedProjects.title: Exam Management System
detailedProjects.tagline: End-to-end digital examination platform for educational institutions
detailedProjects.problem: Educational institutions were managing exams manually, leading to errors in grading, delayed result publication, and lack of analytics for student performance.
detailedProjects.context: Deployed for universities and colleges serving 30,000+ students. Required support for multiple exam types, automated grading, and comprehensive reporting.
contributions: Built exam scheduling and seat allocation algorithms
Developed automated grading engine for objective questions
Created Crystal Reports integration for result cards and transcripts
Implemented Flutter mobile app for students to view results
Optimized database for fast result processing and report generation
detailedProjects.architecture: Three-tier architecture with Spring Boot backend, Flutter mobile frontend, and PostgreSQL database. Redis used for caching exam questions and student data during high-traffic result publication.

challenges.challenge: Simultaneous result access by 30,000+ students causing server overload
challenges.solution: Implemented Redis caching for result data, CDN for static assets, and staggered result publication by batch to distribute load

challenges.challenge: Complex grade calculation with weighted components and normalization
challenges.solution: Built configurable grading engine with support for multiple grading schemes, curve fitting, and what-if analysis

challenges.challenge: Generating thousands of PDF result cards within minutes
challenges.solution: Parallelized Crystal Reports generation using worker pools, pre-rendered templates, and asynchronous job processing

lessons: Caching strategy is essential for handling traffic spikes during result publication
Parallel processing significantly reduces batch operation time
Configurable business logic engines provide flexibility for different institutions
Mobile-first approach improves student engagement and accessibility

detailedProjects.title: Keycloak Authentication Service
detailedProjects.tagline: Enterprise-grade SSO and identity management platform
detailedProjects.problem: Organizations were managing user authentication separately for each application, leading to security vulnerabilities, poor user experience, and high maintenance overhead.
detailedProjects.context: Centralized authentication service for enterprise clients with multiple applications. Required SSO, SAML/OAuth2 support, and integration with existing LDAP/Active Directory.
contributions: Integrated Keycloak with Spring Boot applications using OAuth2/OIDC
Implemented custom user federation for legacy LDAP systems
Built role-based and attribute-based access control (RBAC/ABAC)
Created admin APIs for user and client management
Developed comprehensive security audit and monitoring dashboards
detailedProjects.architecture: Keycloak server as identity provider, Spring Security OAuth2 resource servers for applications. Used PostgreSQL for Keycloak persistence and Redis for session management.

challenges.challenge: Migrating 100K+ users from legacy authentication to Keycloak without disruption
challenges.solution: Implemented phased migration with user federation, allowing gradual transition while maintaining backward compatibility

challenges.challenge: Integrating with diverse client applications using different auth protocols
challenges.solution: Configured Keycloak to support multiple protocols (OAuth2, SAML, LDAP) simultaneously with protocol mappers

challenges.challenge: Managing complex permission hierarchies across applications
challenges.solution: Designed flexible RBAC model with composite roles, group-based permissions, and fine-grained resource-level authorization

lessons: Centralized authentication significantly improves security posture and user experience
User federation enables gradual migration without big-bang cutover
Flexible authorization models are crucial for accommodating diverse application needs
Monitoring and audit logging are essential for security compliance
